abstract: Guyana's Pres Donald Ramotar, who suspended Parliament in November to avoid a no-confidence vote, announces that general elections will be held on May 11.
lead_paragraph: President Donald Ramotar, who suspended Parliament in November to avoid a no-confidence vote, announced Tuesday that general elections would be held on May 11.
snippet: President Donald Ramotar, who suspended Parliament in November to avoid a no-confidence vote, announced Tuesday that general elections would be held on May 11.

headline.main: Guyana: President Announces Date for Elections
headline.print_headline: Guyana: President Announces Date for Elections
